item.title: To amend title 54, United States Code, to provide permanent, dedicated funding for the Land and Water Conservation Fund, and for other purposes.

bill.title: Land and Water Conservation Fund Permanent Funding Act

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 21 - 13.

item.fullName: Rep. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

item.title: H.R. 3195, Land and Water Conservation Fund Permanent Funding Act

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Land and Water Conservation Authorization and Funding Act

This bill makes permanent, beginning in FY2020, funding for the Land and Water Conservation Fund (LWCF).

The President shall annually submit to Congress specified details regarding the allocation of funds to the LWCF. Congress may provide for alternate allocations using specified procedures.

item.latestTitle: Land and Water Conservation Fund Permanent Funding Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. VAN DREW:H.R. 3195.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:U.S. Const. art. I,sec. 8, cl. 3: To regulate Commerce withforeign Nations, and among the several States, and with theIndian tribes.[Page H4432]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
